data.title: Non Stop by Aldiss, First Edition
data.meta_description: Non-Stop by Aldiss, Brian and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Original Boards. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. 1st Book Club Edition. Signed by Brian W. Aldiss in Harrogate in 1962. Dustjacket in plastic protective cover. With remnants and/or residue of sticky tape on endpapers, covers & dustjacket. Slight wear & slight soiling to spine, covers & corners. ; "Non-Stop" by Brian W. Aldiss is a thought-provoking science fiction novel set aboard a generational spaceship, originally destined for a distant planet. Unbeknownst to the current inhabitants, the mission has long been abandoned, and generations have passed with the ship traveling aimlessly through space. The descendants of the original crew have forgotten their true purpose and history, living in a tribal society within the overgrown decks of the ship, where the original functions of the spaceship have devolved into myth and superstition. The story follows Roy Complain, a discontented tribesman who, spurred by a series of personal and communal crises, joins a group of explorers led by a priest, Marapper. They seek to discover the secrets of their world. Their journey leads them through the strange environments of the ship, revealing the truth about their society's origins and the nature of the spaceship. "Non-Stop" is an exploration of human resilience, the quest for knowledge, and the unveiling of one's own reality. ; 19 x 13 x 2 cms; 252 pages; Signed by Author.

Original Cloth. Condition: Good. First Edition. Maroon Boards. I believe this is a Boots Library copy but most of the traces have been carefully removed. There is a faint mark to the centre-bottom of the front panel where the label has been removed and a faint rusty mark to the top edge of the pages next to the spine. Light label residue to rear pastedown. Spine lean, a dark mark to the bottom edges of the pages and a three inch long light stain to the fore edges of the pages. Light browning and marking to top and bottom of page edges. Previous owner's initials neatly to top corner of front pastedown. Lettering on spine faded. Pages otherwise clean and unmarked and fairly unworn. First printing. No jacket.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. First edition, first impression of Aldiss's first SF novel and 3rd book. This has the maroon covers of the first issue. The book is solid and tight and the gold lettering on the spine is bright. But there was a liquid splashed on the foredge with very minor penetration into the pages. The endpapers have light foxing. A gift inscription on the FFEP date 5/17/1958. Top edge has dust staining. The price clipped DJ is complete but has a lot of edge wear, spotting, darkening to the spine and interior foxing. A chance to own this very scarce book in DJ at an affordable price. See the photos-- more available on request.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. HARDBACK BOUND IN THE ORIGINAL CLOTH BINDING WITH THE ORIGINAL UNPRICE CLIPPED DUST JACKET. BOOK MEASURES APPROX 7 x 5 INCHES WITH 252 PAGES. FEW MINOR STAINS TO DUST JACKET WITH SOME MINOR EDGE WEAR, PRIZE PLATE FOR THE PINNER GRAMMER SCHOOL 1965 STUCK DOWN TO FRONT BLANK ENDPAPER BUT OVERALL AN EXCELLENT COPY WITH NO MAJOR FAULTS & CLEAN INTERNALLY PLEASE NOTE THAT THE DUST EXTRA POSTAGE COSTS MAY APPLY TO OVERSEAS ORDERS.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good +. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good +. First Edition. The author's first SF novel. Issued later with textual differences in the U.S. as STARSHIP (1959). A UK first edition, first impression. The scarce first issue of this title with crimson boards. Elusive. THE WRAPPER : The wrapper on this copy is bright, clean and complete. It is unclipped. The front panel is bright and unfaded, showing gentle rubbing and shallow nicks to all corners. The spine is unfaded and shows rubbing and scuffing at the ends. The back panel is sound, showing slight soiling and bruising at the edges and tiny, tiny nicks to the corners. The top edge is lightly bruised with one or two surface creases. Looks sharp in protective plastic. THE BOOK : The book is square and very tight. The boards are very clean. The spine ends. The pages are clean. No foxing. The closed page edges are unmarked - they are gently toned. No dog-eared pages. The binding is solid - no cracked hinges. There are no previous ownership inscriptions. A nice copy in a protected wrapper. Paypal accepted.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. First Edition. Maroon boards and spine, the latter, with a slight lean, lettered in gilt. Crisp jacket shows soiling/browning on rear white panel; top rear front corner rubbed and top front front corner with 4 mm split; 4 mm abrasion on lower front corner; top edge of spine a little frayed. Some foxing to fore-edge. Internally clean, tight and unmarked. Size: 12mo - over 6¾" - 7¾" tall.

First edition, later issue dust jacket. 8vo. Original brown cloth, spine lettered in silver, later issue dust jacket. London, Faber & Faber. Signed by the author to the title page. A superb copy of the second published novel by the prolific British science fiction writer Brian Aldiss set around the total collapse of law and order amongst the inhabitants of a huge generation or 'ark' starship. A fine copy, with only the slightest hint of toning to spine panel, review slip from the publishers for a later 1967 reissue of the book loosely inserted, and later issue jacket.

Hardcover. First edition (& 1st binding state). The author's first sf novel. First binding state ((Currey A) of red/maroon boards and spine lettered in gold: verso of half-title page lists just two books (Space, Time And Nathaniel and The Brightfount diaries) - a later printing in brown cloth lists eight titles (see Currey: Science Fiction And Fantasy Authors, A Bibliography of First Printings of Their Fiction, p. 3). Published in the USA a year later as STARSHIP, which was really stupid and kind of spoils everything as the whole point of the novel is that you only slowly realise (like in the last 20 pages) that events are taking place on a Generation Starship and not on a planet! SIGNED BY THE AUTHOR. Very faint spotting along top page edges, else a fine copy in a near fine (bright, unfaded pictorial) dustjacket.

First Edition. First Edition. Copy belonging to the author's British agent, E.J. Carnell in London, with their label on the front endpaper, reading "NON-STOP / by / Brian W. Aldiss / First American Rights" in manuscript manual type. Considered by many to be Aldiss' finest work. The American edition, for which this copy was ostensibly the template, was retitled "Starship," with many textual revisions. An exceptional copy of the author's third book in terms of both condition and relevance to its publication history. In a custom red cloth slipcase. A touch of rubbing to the jacket rear panel along with a small closed tear and a 1-inch tear (neatly repaired with cellotape at the verso). All told, Fine and unread in an about Near Fine dust jacket. Anatomy of Wonder (1995) 3-4. Pringle 25.

First edition, first printing. Octavo, boards. Signed by Aldiss on the title page. The author's first sf novel. Issued later with textual differences in the U.S. as STARSHIP (1959). ". a brilliant treatment of the generation starship and also the theme of conceptual breakthrough in a kind of spacegoing ruined-Earth society; it has become a classic of the field and in 2008 was awarded a retrospective British Science Fiction Association Award for best novel of 1958." - John Clute / David Pringle, SFE (online). Anatomy of Wonder (1995) 3-4. Pringle: Science Fiction: The 100 Best Novels #25. Gerber, Utopian Fantasy (1973), p. 160. A little foxing to edges of first few and last few leaves, a fine copy in a fine dust jacket with slight rubs to the front corner tips. (28433).
